intro: Sida medicaginis, commonly known as hairy sida, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits.
